title: Naples, Florida, House on a Double Lot Heads to Auction Without Reserve
text:
A 7,418-square-foot home in Naples, Florida, is set to be sold in a live, no-reserve auction on Nov. 2, according to Elite Auctions, which is handling the sale.



Built in 2009 on a double lot, the main house has four bedrooms, six bathrooms and two half bathrooms, plus a private apartment on the top floor, according to the listing. And there’s a separate 2,153-square-foot guest house.



The successful bidder will also be immediately eligible for a full membership at the Grey Oaks Country Club, according to Randy Haddaway, CEO and founder of Elite Auctions.



“Naples is one of the most premier, if not the premier city, in all of Florida for golfing,” he said. “And I would say this is the top location within Naples.”



Owned by Craig Brown, the owner of the South Carolina-based minor league baseball team Greenville Drive, who are affiliated with the Boston Red Sox, the home was most recently listed for $7.95 million. But it first came on the market in February 2016 for $12 million, according to listing records. That listing was removed at the end of 2017.



The home was relisted in January 2018 for just under $10 million, but still has not found a buyer, even at its lower price. Now Mr. Brown is looking to “motivate the market” with an auction, Mr. Haddaway said. At the end of the day on Nov. 2, the house will be sold, he added.

Mr. Brown bought the property in 2008 for $922,500, according to property records. Now he and his family have “decided to downsize and move out of state,” Mr. Haddaway explained. Mr. Brown was not immediately available for comment.



Naples-based Stofft Cooney Architects designed the residence, which was inspired by homes in the West Indies, according to the listing. The property has two pools, manicured gardens and several patios and terraces to make the most of Florida’s endless summer weather.



The main house has the clean lines of a modern home, featuring a formal living room with garden views and a bar, a sitting room with a fireplace and an eat-in kitchen with exposed beams, custom cabinetry and Viking and Miele appliances.

Pocket sliding doors lead out to a loggia, which boasts a summer kitchen, automated screens and shutters, a heated pool and views of the golf course’s eighth fairway and private preserve beyond. The second pool is a linear reflecting pool, and there’s a gazebo and gas fire pit.



Other features include a master suite with a private study and sitting area, a media room, a climate-controlled 1,000 bottle wine cellar, a 12-camera security system, two separate two-car garages and a golf cart garage.
